alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 14 at 3:33AM MST until February 15 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Snow showers today will increase and become heavier this afternoon and tonight. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches in the lower elevations, with 6 to 12 inches over the higher elevations. Winds gusting as high as 45 to 55 mph. * WHERE...Areas near Alpine, Buffalo Pass, Chinle, Eagar- Springerville, Ganado, Kayenta, Pinetop-Lakeside, Saint Johns, Shonto, Show Low, Whiteriver and Window Rock. * WHEN...From noon today to noon MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions due to snow-covered roads. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility with areas of near white-out conditions possible. The hazardous conditions will impact the Tuesday evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. Snow forecast from noon Today to noon Wednesday: Alpine 8 to 12 inches Buffalo Pass 11 to 17 inches Chinle 2 to 4 inches Eagar-Sprgrvlle 4 to 8 inches Ganado 4 to 8 inches Kayenta 3 to 5 inches Pinetop-Lkside 11 to 17 inches Saint Johns 3 to 5 inches Shonto 4 to 8 inches Show Low 9 to 15 inches Whiteriver 4 to 6 inches Window Rock 5 to 9 inches .
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
